definition: to agree/to consent/to be ready (to do sth)/willing
Germany/German/abbr. for 德國|德国[De2 guo2]

sentences.english: Members of the Farmers' Association descended upon Kentucky for their annual conference.
sentences.chinese: 农民协会成员突然造访肯德基的年会。

sentences.english: This ticket entitles you to get a free French fries in the KFC.
sentences.chinese: 凭此券你可以在肯德基免费得到一份炸薯条。

sentences.english: But you haven't done it in a big way like KFC has done.
sentences.chinese: 但是你们的调整幅度并没有像肯德基那么大。

sentences.english: Isn't that like KFC advertising salmonella chicken?" --Jay Leno
sentences.chinese: 这难道不就是像肯德基做广告说，要卖沙门氏菌鸡吗？

sentences.english: KFC claims 0g trans fat per serving for all their fried chicken.
sentences.chinese: 肯德基声称它们的炸鸡中不含反式脂肪酸。

sentences.english: Like its predecessor, Kentucky Fried Chicken has its own secret recipe.
sentences.chinese: 和它的前辈一样，肯德基烤鸡肉也有自己的秘方。

sentences.english: We eat lunch in Louisville, Kentucky, and then we go to amusement parks.
sentences.chinese: 我们在肯德基吃午饭，然后我们去游乐园。

sentences.english: In the morning, this KFC was so quiet that we chatted here for more than one hour.
sentences.chinese: 早上的肯德基很清静，我们在这里胡侃了一个多小时。

sentences.english: Crab meat in KFC dish raises stink on the Net.
sentences.chinese: 肯德基用鱼肉假冒黄金蟹斗引发网络骂声一片。

sentences.english: Salesgirl: Welcome to KFC! What can I do for you?
sentences.chinese: 欢迎光临肯德基，有什么我能效劳的？

sentences.english: And you might have to make reservations to get a table at KFC.
sentences.chinese: 要想在肯德基就餐，你也许还得订餐。

sentences.english: Doctor , I am living well. I go to KFC for Mcdonald's frequently.
sentences.chinese: 师傅，我现在过得很好，经常去肯德基里吃吃麦当劳。

sentences.english: I went to a small city that only had 2 kfcs and one pizza hut.
sentences.chinese: 我去过一个只有两家肯德基和一家披萨馆的小城市。

sentences.english: SpongeBob has even hawked Kentucky Fried Chicken.
sentences.chinese: 海绵宝宝的包装袋甚至出现在了肯德基里。

sentences.english: The company never said the soybeans were freshly ground.
sentences.chinese: 肯德基公司从未提及豆浆是用大豆现磨的。
